cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 255 mi south of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn northwest Sunday–Monday, then move northward across the southeastern Gulf of Mexico toward the west-central Florida coast mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coast near the Tampa Bay region

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for Florida as of Advisory #7
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for Florida as of Advisory #7
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida peninsula west coast, from the Keys northward through the Big Bend
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds possible by Wednesday; hurricane-force winds cannot be ruled out if Ian remains strong near landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential life-threatening surge of 3–6 ft along the west-central Florida coast, including Tampa Bay and Port Manatee.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches possible with locally higher amounts; flash and urban flooding risk mid-week.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and possible tornadoes in outer rainbands.
